name: Administrative Building Quest
title: The Director's Challenge
description: Navigate through the historic Administrative Building of MNNIT, discovering its architectural secrets and rich heritage through challenging puzzles.

clues.text: MNNIT became an NIT in a year. Add the digits of this year. The sum should be divided by 2 to reveal your next step.
clues.hint: The answer lies in a plaque near the main gate. Think of the digits like a secret code: once you have it, split it in half!

clues.text: Golden frames hold the legacy of leadership. How many directors' portraits are displayed in gold frames?
clues.hint: Count carefully. But here's the twist: not all frames are gold! Ignore the silver ones. Reflect on what's missing and only count the golden memories.

clues.text: At the main entrance, count the pillars. Multiply this number by the windows on the front facade, then divide by 4.
clues.hint: Not all windows are obvious! Some are hidden behind curtains or plants. Find the total and think outside the box.

name: Cafe69 Adventure
title: Culinary Code Quest
description: Explore MNNIT's favorite hangout spot, Cafe69, where food meets fun in this exciting treasure hunt.

clues.text: The most popular combo meal has a hidden code. Its price divided by 10 is the answer.
clues.hint: Look for a hidden discount code in the fine print of the menu. Sometimes, the best deals are hidden in plain sight. Find the price, then find its hidden meaning.

clues.text: Ceiling fans spin overhead, but how many are there? Multiply the number you see by 2.
clues.hint: The fans may not all be running. Look for shadows or ceiling mounts. Sometimes what's not moving is just as important as what is.

clues.text: How many stone benches are there in the garden section? The answer is hidden among the greenery.
clues.hint: Not all benches are easy to see. Some may be hidden behind plants or trees. Use your observation skills to uncover the hidden seating.

name: Central Library Mystery
title: Knowledge Navigator
description: Dive into the vast repository of knowledge at MNNIT's Central Library, where books hold more than just information.

clues.text: Add the edition numbers of all the Kreyszig Engineering Mathematics books on the first bookshelf.
clues.hint: Each edition number hides a clue. Find all the Kreyszig books, sum their edition numbers, and see what secret they reveal. Be careful not to count any reprints or duplicates.

clues.text: What floor has the IEEE journal section? Multiply this by the number of computer labs in the entire library.
clues.hint: Check the electronic catalog for IEEE journals. It might also list the locations of computer labs. Use logic and calculation to find your way.

clues.text: Count the ceiling lights in the main reading hall. Divide this count by the number of emergency exits.
clues.hint: Emergency exits are marked but often overlooked. Don't just look up for lightsâ€”also look around for hidden exits.
